page.title: 05THE EAST SOMERSET RAILWAY.
page.content: The East Somerset Railway at Cranmore started its life in 1858 as The East Somerset Railway, but in between has been called{The Great Western Railway, and been part of the{Western Region}of {British Railways.}The station and line were closed to passengers in 1963 but by 1973 work was well on the way to building a locomotive shed and opening the line to visitors. The{painter}and {artist David Shepherd}started all this when he decided to make Cranmore the home for his famous{Black Prince and {Green Knight locomotives.}Since 1973 many new locos,carriages and wagons have arrived and new sections of line have been re_opened. Cranmore Station was opened to passengers again in 1984 and the line now stretches for about 2 miles towards Shepton Mallet with three small halts along it.
